news.title: Life lessons from 107-year-old Tannie Cora
news.content:
By Tracy-Lynn Ruiters l Weekend Argus

Cora Tannie Cora Snyman Louw, born on April 4, 1918, in Klipdam near Kimberley, South Africa has lived through an extraordinary century of history, witnessing world events and personal milestones that few can fathom.

Born towards the end of World War I, she has lived through two World Wars, two pandemics, and witnessed the rapid transformation of technologyfrom horse-drawn carts to self-driving cars.

Her journey is not just one of longevity but of an incredible life well-lived, marked by wisdom, and deep appreciation for family and lifes small pleasures.

As one of the first nurses at Groote Schuur Hospital, Tannie Coras career was centered on care, dedication, and an eagerness to learn.

She married a doctor in 1942, with whom she had two children, Leon and Zandra. Her passion for floristry began when her youngest was just nine years old, and she later expanded her business into an estate agency.

I went through the thick and thin of life

Her life took her to Durban, Johannesburg, and back to Cape Town, where she lived out her later years near the beach, developing a close bond with her neighbour, Sylwa Malan.

In her later years, Tannie Cora moved to the then Huis Lckhoff, now known as Rosebank House, at the age of 81, where she enjoyed a rich community life filled with music, scripture studies, and visits from loved ones.

Now, at 107 years old, Tannie Cora has become a living testament to resilience and a source of wisdom for those around her, imparting life lessons that include the importance of family unity, fairness, humor, and staying engaged with life.

James Wichary, the Manager of Rosebank House, recalled the first day he met Tannie Cora. She was one of the first people I met when I started here, Wichary shared.

Everyone talked about Tannie Cora, and when I heard she was 106, I thought, That means she was born in 1918, absolutely astonishing! She lived through two world wars, two pandemics, and witnessed the world transform. She is like a living, breathing encyclopedia.

Wichary admires Tannie Coras vitality, noting, You can still have a conversation with her.

The energy is vibrant and engaging, and she knows whats going on around her. She enjoys family visits, soaking up the sun, and is quite funny.

Staff member Allison Goodheart also fondly remembers when Tannie Cora was wheeled into the sunroom on her birthday, beaming with delight.

Shes still very aware of everything around her, Goodheart said.

When we brought her cake, she looked at it and said, Beautiful!

When asked how she feels at 107, Tannie Cora replied with a twinkle in her eye: Happy chappy! I still look 91, and then cracked a little smirk, adding a playful touch to the conversation.

Her great-niece, Margi Marshland, shared how Tannie Cora had been feeling after her recent birthday, which they had feared might be her last.

Last year, we thought it would be her last birthday.

She got very sick, and she even told us she was ready to meet the Lord. But this year, she started asking about the days leading up to her birthday, counting them down. Its a blessing to spend another birthday with her.

Marshlands sister, Berit Bradfield, and family friend Alet Steenkamp expressed gratitude for every moment spent with Tannie Cora.

We are thankful to the Lord for sparing her another year, Marshland said. There are good and bad days, but today, were just happy to be with her. Even when shes not as talkative, you can still feel her presence.

Life Lessons from Tannie Cora include, You can make life very beautiful just by having a united family; Learn how to get along with people; It takes a lot of energy and patience to be a parent; Dont assume that another person is a fool; being late is an insult and disrespectful to those waiting for you; friends are very important and never forget your sense of humour.
news.description:

Born towards the end of World War I, she has lived through two World Wars,

news.title: Woman dies after husband forces poison down her throat during fight
news.content:
By Staff Reporter

AN enraged Kwekwe man did the unthinkable during a domestic dispute by forcing his wife to drink a poisonous substance, which resulted in health complications leading to her death.

Norest Ndlovu (29) of Qagani village, Chief Malisa was arraigned before the Kwekwe Magistrates Court facing a murder charge.

Circumstances are that on May 17, 2024, at around 9pm, a domestic dispute broke out between the accused person and his wife, who is now deceased.

Court heard that during the ensuing battle, Ndlovu overpowered his wife before shoving a poisonous substance down her throat.

She gulped the poison and started frothing on the mouth and writhing in agony complaining of stomach cramps and was later rushed to hospital.

The now deceased was admitted in medical facility and later discharged. Thereafter, she was in and out of hospital until she succumbed to the effects of the poison on March 4 this year.

Ndlovu was remanded in custody to April 17, 2025, and advised to apply for bail at the High Court.

Norest Ndlovu (29) of Qagani village, Chief Malisa was arraigned before the Kwekwe Magistrates’ Court facing a murder charge. Circumstances are that on

news.title: Abuse scandal rocks school: Deputy Head flees after allegedly molesting over 30 pupils
news.content:
By Costa Nkomo

CONTROVERSY has engulfed Masase High School in Mberengwa district, as Deputy Headmaster Anymore Gumbo is on the run after allegedly sexually molesting over 30 pupils at the iconic boarding school, NewZimbabwe.com can reveal.

Taungana Ndoro, Director of Communications for the Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education, confirmed the incident.

We are aware of the incident and investigations are in progress, he said.

Gumbo allegedly carried out his depraved acts on numerous occasions on different pupils over a period of time, until he recently injured a Form Two student.

The victim, reportedly experiencing severe discomfort, cried out, alerting fellow pupils and shattering the wall of silence that had concealed Gumbos alleged abuse. This marked the beginning of Gumbos downfall as his web of deceit began to unravel.

Gumbo reportedly fled the school premises last Friday night as law enforcement agents came to investigate the matter and question him.

The scandal came to light after one of the pupils required medical attention following an alleged assault by Gumbo. This medical intervention, like Pandoras Box, unleashed a torrent of accusations.

In a letter addressed to parents and guardians Wednesday, headmaster Albion Masukume confirmed that investigations are underway, involving both the police and the Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education.

I write with deep sorrow to inform you that allegations of child abuse by one of our staff members was reported, he said.

Currently thorough investigations by Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education and the police are underway. The alleged victim was taken to hospital swiftly and was examined by a medical doctor.

A police report was filed with the Victim Friendly Unit at Mberengwa Charge Office the same day. Meanwhile the alleged perpetrator is not at the station and being sought after for interrogation so that he responds to the allegations, reads part of the letter dated April 3, 2025.

While Midlands provincial police spokesperson Inspector Emmanuel Mahoko would neither confirm nor deny the incident to NewZimbabwe.com. He was quoted in a State-run newspaper confirming the incident.

However, when contacted by this publication, Mahoko denied ever speaking to any journalist concerning the matter.

Tafanana Zhou, legislator for Mberengwa North, which encompasses Masase High School, confirmed the assaults but refrained from speculating on the number of victims.

We need to wait for investigations to complete so that we will be able to establish the number of learners that were involved in this incident. We should not speculate.

Obert Masaraure, President of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe (ARTUZ), condemned the alleged abuse, urging the school to bolster its safeguarding procedures.

The molestation of children at a learning institution is extremely worrisome, he said.

Schools should be safe for both teachers and learners. ARTUZ has proposed safe schools regulations and if these had been adopted such incidents would have been avoided.

In Zimbabwe, engaging in sexual acts with a minor under 18, including sodomy, is illegal under Section 73 (3) of the Criminal Law (Codification and Reform) Act Chapter 9:23 and carries a maximum prison sentence of 10 years.

Taungana Ndoro, Director of Communications for the Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education, confirmed the incident.  “We are aware

news.title: Chiragwi and Navaya scoop monthly PSL awards
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

NGEZI Platinum Stars coach Takesure Chiragwi has been voted Premier Soccer League (PSL) Coach of The Month for March.

Chiragwi has managed a four-match unbeaten run in the league, a performance that has seen his side seating on the summit of the log table.

The Mhondoro-based side is one of the four teams yet to taste defeat in the league, the other three being MWOS, Dynamos and FC Platinum.

Ngezi recorded a false start into the league, after a 1-1 draw against Kwekwe United on match-day one before winning its last three encounters against Green Fuel, Scottland F.C and Triangle.

Chiragwi was voted Coach of The Month ahead of MWOS FC coach Lloyd Mutasa, who has managed eight points from four matches.

Meanwhile, TelOne striker Washington Navaya has scooped the leagues Player of The Month award.

The veteran forward banged four goals in four matches, the highest by any player so far in the league.

Chiragwi has managed a four-match unbeaten run in the league, a performance that has seen his side seating on the summit of the log table. The Mhondoro-based side is one of the four

The post Chiragwi and Navaya scoop monthly PSL awards appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: PSL outfit Kwekwe United faces financial crisis, fails to pay players
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

CASTLE Lager Premier Soccer League (PSL) newcomers Kwekwe United are in a financial logjam that has seen it failing to pay players for two consecutive months, New Zimbabwe.com has learnt.

The Midlands province-based side is owing players monthly salaries accumulating to two months, while other members of the squad are yet to be fully paid their sign on fees.

Led by head coach Saul Chaminuka, the outfit is currently occupying position 15 with four points, three places on top of bottom place occupiers Triangle.

Talking to NewZimbabwe.com on condition of anonymity, one of the players said the club is struggling to meet match-day expenses.

The situation here (Kwekwe United) is tough. Most of the guys are owed part of their sign-on fees.

Other than that, we are owed two months salaries by the club and there is no guarantee when we can receive our dues.

Our superiors are struggling to adjust to the financial demands that comes with topflight league football, because its always a hustle for us to camp and prepare for each match-day, be it home or away, said the source.

Kwekwe Uniteds woes are now a public secret. On Friday afternoon an audio in which team assistant coach Clemence Zuze was asking for players to bring personal blankets in camp ahead of their clash against FC leaked and was circulating on social media.

Morning l am kindly advising you that todays camping in Gweru will be at a farm, as per programme, lunch will be served there as well as our dinner, the same tomorrow.

It seems their accommodation does not have enough necessities hence you are being asked to bring your personal blankets.

For those at the club house, kindly carry along your mattresses as well, said Zuze in the audio.

Kwekwe United hosts FC Platinum at Bata Stadium in Gweru this Saturday afternoon, a match they will be hoping to bounce back to winning ways after last weeks defeat to Yadah F.C.

The Midlands province-based side is owing players monthly salaries accumulating to two months, while other members of the squad are yet to

news.title: Ex-Finance minister rejects Mnangagwa’s third term bid; flags corrupt plan to protect tycoon Tagwirei and cartels
news.content:
By Staff Reporter

FORMER Finance minister Tendai Biti has rejected President Emmerson Mnangagwas 2030 agenda, calling it a corrupt plan meant to hedge ill-gotten wealth and thrust known plunderers into powerful government positions.

According to vocal war veteran Blessed Bomshell Geza, Mnangagwas third term bid known as 2030 agenda is being pushed by corrupt individuals surrounding him, who include his ally Kuda Tagwirei, controversial businessmen Wicknell Chivayo, Obey Chimuka and Scott Sakupwanya, Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube, Finance Permanent Secretary George Guvamatanga, former Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ) Governor John Mangudya and others.

Geza also recently claimed that Mnangagwa was clandestinely grooming Tagwirei to take over the presidency, thereby thwarting his deputy Constantino Chiwengas leadership ambitions.

Tagwirei has started maneuvering into the structures of the ruling party Zanu PF after his name was put forward by the Harare provincial leadership to assume a role in the Central Committee, one of the partys most powerful organs.

However, Biti condemned Mnangagwas plot to perpetuate his incumbency and expressed strong opposition to the corrupt cartels and individuals, who have been looting Zimbabwes wealth for years.

We are totally opposed to the third term agenda and its cousin Agenda 2030.We make no apology for this.

We firmly believe that this is an agenda spurned by corruption and the need to protect lucre loot and ill begotten sachets.

We therefore stand firmly against cartels, bandits, charlatans and brigands, who have been looting Zimbabwe for decades.

We object to dangerous attempts to elevate some of these looters into the countrys corridors of power.

We are not members of Zanu PF. We refuse to be drawn in by their endless toxic factions and power struggles, Biti wrote on his official social media account.

Tagwirei has come under fire for allegedly using his close relationship with Mnangagwa to secure lucrative government deals, growing his influence in mining and fuel, and taking key leadership roles in agriculture and land policy.
news.description:
By Staff Reporter FORMER Finance minister Tendai Biti has rejected President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s “2030 agenda”, calling it a corrupt plan meant to hedge ill-gotten wealth and thrust known plunderers into powerful government positions. According to vocal war veteran Blessed ‘Bomshell’ Geza, Mnangagwa’s third term bid known as “2030 agenda” is being pushed by corrupt individuals

The post Ex-Finance minister rejects Mnangagwa’s third term bid; flags corrupt plan to protect tycoon Tagwirei and cartels appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: Diaspora Insurance CEO wins prestigious Africa-UK business award
news.content:
By UK Correspondent

DIASPORA Insurance CEO, Jeff Madzingo, has been honoured with another Africa-UK business award in recognition of his groundbreaking work across multiple African countries and the diaspora.

The Business Executive Media Group recently confirmed that Madzingo had won the 2025 Excellence In Transformative Insurance Solutions award following our comprehensive multi-step selection process.

Since its establishment some 13 years ago, Madzingo has overseen the phenomenal growth ofDiaspora Insuranceinto a multi-million-dollar company with operations and clients in the UK, the EU, the USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Middle East and across Africa.

From its global headquarters in Birmingham, the company now covers 20 African nationalities wherever they are based across the world.

This prestigious award recognizes your transformative leadership as CEO of Diaspora Insurance, reads the citation for the award.

It highlights your groundbreaking work in expanding insurance coverage across multiple African countries, empowering diasporans through bespoke and innovative insurance solutions, and contributing significantly to the economic and social fabric of Zimbabwes diaspora.

The recognition comes after Madzingo made the top 20 in the African Business Chambers Top 100 African Entrepreneurs and Business Leaders in the UK for 2024.

The top one hundred were chosen from as highly competitive process, with over 425 nominations submitted.

Meanwhile, the latest award will be conferred at a glamourous dinner gala in London on the 25thof April which will also include the 2025 African-UK Business Conference.

The organisers added; Your imminent conferment makes you a member of a unique, formally recognized grouping of private enterprises and public and multilateral institutions as well as exemplary individuals who are leading the expansion of trade and investment activity between Africa and the United Kingdom and who hold the potential to expand commercial business relationships between the two regions much further going forward.

Diaspora Insurance offers the groundbreaking and bespoke Diaspora Funeral Cash Plan which has proved to be popular with the global African diaspora, ensuring families are spared the double trauma of grieving and begging in times of bereavement.

The company boasts double digit growth in gross written premiums while claim settlements now run into US$ millions as thousands of bereaved families have benefited from timely financial intervention to deal with the financial shocks of diaspora death.

Millions in US dollar cash has been paid to bereaved families across the globe the company says.

In addition, newly introduced and innovative products like COS Funeral Scheme, Diaspora Students Shield have completely changed the narrative when it comes to Diaspora bereavement by guaranteeing everyone a dignified send off and a celebrated life.

The Business Executive Media Group recently confirmed that Madzingo had won the 2025 “Excellence In Transformative Insurance Solutions” award “following our comprehensive multi-step selection process”. Since

The post Diaspora Insurance CEO wins prestigious Africa-UK business award appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: Ken Sharpe inspires Zimbabweans to build lasting wealth
news.content:
By Staff Reporter

Renowned entrepreneur and WestProp Chief, Mr. Ken Sharpe, has rallied Zimbabweans to strive for generational wealth that transcends lifetimes. Speaking at the CEO Africa Roundtable Zimbabwe Wealth and Retirement Summit, Mr. Sharpe emphasized the importance of creating wealth that benefits future generations.

Wealth is not just about accumulating riches; its about leaving a lasting legacy, Sharpe declared. God blesses us to be a blessing to others. Its our responsibility to use our wealth to uplift others, whether through family, philanthropy, or community development.

As a self-proclaimed man of the future, Sharpes vision extends far beyond the present. WestProps ambitious goal is to lay one billion bricks by 2050, a testament to Sharpes unwavering dedication to Zimbabwes growth.

We must think beyond our own lifetimes, Sharpe urged. We cant take our wealth to the grave, but we can ensure its transformation and passage to the next generation. Its crucial we teach our children and grandchildren the value of wealth creation, moral integrity, and a strong work ethic.

Sharpe praised the CEO Africa Roundtable for fostering a collaborative environment, where minds converge to find solutions. Together, we can make a difference in Zimbabwe, he exclaimed. Lets join forces to build a brighter future for our nation and our children.

news.title: Emotional Intelligence and Team Dynamics in Esports
news.content:
When it comes to e-sports, where the stakes are great and the competition is fierce, emotional intelligence (EI) is essential. Emotionally intelligent teams are known for being tough, communicating eloquently, and having strong team dynamics, all of which are important for winning competitive games. When integrated well, EI helps these efforts and turns possible losses into chances to win. For a more profound understanding of how emotional intelligence can shape successful esports teams,Avia Mastersoffers further insights.

Understanding EI in Esports

In e-sports, emotional intelligence (EI) is a key factor that affects how teams communicate and work together. Teams with higher emotional intelligence understand and care about each other more, which makes working together much easier. This knowledge helps the team work together better and communicate more clearly.

EI is also essential to managing disagreements within teams. Being aware of and controlling individual and team emotions can prevent arguments from worsening. This helps the team stay focused and work together and strengthens them overall, so they can handle the pressure of competitive play and adapt to constantly changing conditions.

When there is a lot of pressure to do well in e-sports, teams that can talk to each other and work out their differences are more likely to win. Emotional intelligence helps people on a team say what they want to say, listen carefully, and reply to each other with understanding and empathy.

Building Trust Through EI

When people on an e-sports team feel understood and respected, they are much more likely to trust each other. This is called emotional intelligence (EI). EI leaders are good at recognising and controlling their emotions as well as understanding and reacting to the emotions of the people on their team. Being able to do this makes you more empathetic, which is important for making strong, trusting connections.

Good conversation is key to emotional intelligence and building trust. Leaders and team members can avoid misunderstandings and ensure that everyones voice is heard and valued by listening carefully and responding with care. In addition, EI helps team members handle disagreements in a healthy way by focussing on solutions instead of blaming each other.

Training and Development

Esports teams can improve their emotional intelligence by using various training programmes meant to boost teamwork and success. Workshops and classes that cover important EI skills, like self-awareness, empathy, and interpersonal communication skills, are common parts of effective EI training. During these meetings, team members usually learn about EI in a theoretical way and then apply what theyve learned to practical situations.

Furthermore, role-playing and simulation games are helpful because they let team members practise controlling their emotions and reacting with empathy in different situations. Mindfulness and stress management training can also be added to help team members better control their emotions and stay strong.

Photo byAxvilleonUnsplash

Psychological Aspects and Winning Mindset

Emotional intelligence (EI) greatly affects the mental and emotional skills needed to perform at your best in e-sports.

Here are some key benefits of EI in developing a winning mindset and enhancing team resilience:
